definition: to return to the point of departure

sentences.english: Which had been searching the Barents Sea for weeks, was on its way home.
sentences.chinese: 在巴倫支海搜尋了幾個星期之後，正在返航途中。

sentences.english: We need some more men to turn the ship around.
sentences.chinese: 我們需增派更多的人手使這艘船卸貨返航。

sentences.english: The ship eventually turned around and headed home, thereby avoiding a search.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船最終掉頭返航，才得以避免搜查。

sentences.english: After returning from the Arctic Ocean, the ship was laid up for repairs.
sentences.chinese: 船從北冰洋返航以後就入塢修理。

sentences.english: The ship will touch at 3 ports on the return voyage.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船在返航時要在3個港口停靠。

sentences.english: LiuChangLing are return, he has confidence can fly back.
sentences.chinese: 劉長嶺正在返航，他有信心能飛回去。

sentences.english: He didn’t remove the barb but piloted the boat to land and got help.
sentences.chinese: 他並沒有拔掉魚的倒刺而是返航到岸上需求幫助。

sentences.english: It would need to wait until the ships returned from Hardhome, to be sure.
sentences.chinese: 當然，要等到去艱難堡的艦隊返航之後。

sentences.english: United Airlines spokesman said the driver, fuel venting, the return emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 聯航發言人說，駕駛員將燃油放空後，返航緊急降落。

sentences.english: Return later, remove the sample bottle and query the data on-site.
sentences.chinese: 返航後，取出採樣瓶和進行現場數據查詢。

sentences.english: On the return voyage the yacht capsized in a sudden squall.
sentences.chinese: 在返航途中游艇被突然襲來的狂風暴雨所傾覆。

sentences.english: No signs of the hostile. I think we got him. Buraq 2 retuning to convoy.
sentences.chinese: 沒有方針跡象，我想他逝世了，耗炸機2號返航。

sentences.english: Red the rosy sunset, BaiYu carrying concern remains a tearful return.
sentences.chinese: 血紅的晚霞中，白羽載着關心的遺體含淚返航。

sentences.english: Our Valentine's loyalty will be waiting for our return return it?
sentences.chinese: 我們的情人會忠貞不二的等待我們返航歸來嗎？

definition: to form into columns/to organize into teams/formation (of ships or aircraft)
to force a plane to land
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
